name: Headache
description: Headache is pain or discomfort in the head or face region. It is commonly caused by stress, dehydration, lack of sleep, eye strain, or mild infections.

mild.definition: Mild headache with short duration and no danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe headache or headache with neurological danger signs

self_care: Rest in a quiet, dark room
Avoid bright screens and loud noise
Apply a cold compress to forehead or neck

medicines.name: Paracetamol 500mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of mild to moderate headache pain
medicines.dose: Adults: 500–1000 mg every 6 hours (Maximum 4000 mg in 24 hours)

medicines.name: Ibuprofen 400mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Headache with inflammation or tension component
medicines.dose: Adults: 400 mg every 6–8 hours with food (Maximum 1200 mg in 24 hours OTC)

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if the headache is severe, sudden, persistent beyond a week, or associated with vision changes, confusion, neck stiffness, or vomiting.

assessment_questions.question: How many days have you had this headache?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent care for sudden or severe headaches.
